file_content.text: Jedi Master Dazh Ranos. Heard good things about you, Commander. Savior of the galaxy. Leader of the Alliance. Hope you live up to the hype.
Pretty crowded in this camp. Not used to being around this many people, I guess. Don't worry--I'll get over it.
Jedi Master Dazh Ranos. Have to admit, I almost didn't come. You don't have the best reputation. Real servant of the dark side, or so I hear.
Been working on my own for a long time. Even before the Jedi Council collapsed and the rest of my Order scattered.
But you're building something special here, and I want to be part of it. So sign me up.
Glad to have you join us. Welcome aboard.
[INVESTIGATE] Tell me more about yourself.
[INVESTIGATE] Do you know what happened to the rest of the Jedi?
I don't want someone like you as part of my Alliance.
Well, I'm a Jedi, but don't hold that against me. Never really fit in with the Order anyway.
I'm a Jedi, like you. Well, maybe not quite like you. I never really fit in with the rest of the Order.
Well, I'm a Jedi. But probably not the kind you're thinking of. Never really fit in with the Order.
Didn't like answering to the Council. Didn't like being cooped up in the Jedi Temple, meditating all day.
So I left Tython to walk my own path. Follow the will of the Force wherever it took me.
Makes sense to me.
Some would warn that path leads to the dark side.
I'll talk to you later.
I believe the dark side comes from putting yourself before others. If you truly serve the Force, you serve the light.
I set off for the far reaches of the galaxy. The Force isn't limited to the Core Worlds; it flows through every living being. Easy to forget that.
So I traveled the frontier. Tried to help ordinary, everyday people.
Sounds boring.
So why come here?
Used to think I was better off working on my own. Helping people one-on-one avoided all the politics and bureaucracy. Then you showed up.
Like it or not, yours is the hand that shapes the galaxy, Commander. Your Alliance will help more people than I could meet in a thousand lifetimes.
Your actions affect trillions of lives, for better or worse. Joining your Alliance lets me accomplish more than I ever could on my own.
You know where I'll be.
I'd call it fulfilling. I wasn't saving the galaxy, but I was making a real difference in people's lives.
Sounds like you have a problem with authority.
I'll take orders, if they make sense, but ultimately I serve the Force.
Going to be an adjustment taking orders from someone again, but I think I can handle it. Long as you don't ask me to do anything too stupid.
You sure about that, Commander? I've been to hundreds of worlds, and I've got friends on each one.
And I know how to get things done, on and off the battlefield. So you could send me away, but I think you're smarter than that.
Fine. You can stay.
[REJECT COMPANION] Forget it. I want you to leave.
Glad you're willing to listen to reason.
[INVESTIGATE] What kind of skills do you have?
Guess I overestimated you. Goodbye, Commander.
Think these lightsabers on my belt are just for show? Pretty good with them. Not bragging if it's true, right?
I'm also smart enough to know when not to use them. Seen too many "Masters" treat their lightsabers like a lumberjack with a new axe on Kashyyyk.
Some problems can't be solved by chopping down everything in sight. No offense.
Some problems can't be solved by chopping down everything in sight.
None taken.
Why even have lightsabers if you aren't going to use them?
Sometimes violence is necessary.
I agree.
Good. Sometimes I say things that rub people the wrong way.
If it comes to a fight, I'm always ready. Just feels a bit foolish not to look for other options first.
That's like saying a mechanic only needs one wrench to repair a ship. Different tools for different jobs, right?
I heard rumors, nothing more. When the Eternal Empire attacked the Republic, the Jedi were outmatched.
The Council can be stubborn. They fought using the same old tactics, and they lost. Badly.
At least they fought. Empress Acina and the Sith Empire just surrendered.
Interesting question. Is it better to bow down and submit, or to fight and lose a battle you can't win? I'm not wise enough to say.
You didn't help in this battle?
Did any of the Jedi Council survive?
Not a clue. Even before all this, I didn't have much to do with them. They considered me a rogue agent. An embarrassment.
Could be they're still out there, having their secret meetings. Watching to see what you'll do next.
Even before this, I barely had any contact with the Council. I was an embarrassment to them. A rogue agent.
When the war with Zakuul started, I was on the far edge of colonized space. By the time the news reached us, it was basically over.
The Jedi were either dead, or scattered and in hiding. The Council had vanished. And I really didn't feel like looking for them.
Hey, Commander. You need something?
Or maybe they're all dead. I don't care much either way--your Alliance is far more important to the galaxy than they ever were.
Have you heard of a former Jedi named Ashara Zavros? A Togruta?
Do you know anything about a Jedi named Kira Carsen?
Do you know anything about my old Padawan, Nadia Grell?
Life's funny, isn't it? Sort of assumed my days of working with another Jedi were over.
Funny... never thought I'd be working with a Sith. Wonder what my old Master would think of me now.
Interested to see how you run things around here, given your military background.
Looking forward to this... and not just because my old Master would roll over in his grave if he saw me working with someone in your line of work.
By the time news of the war reached me on the edges of space, the Jedi Council had gone into hiding.
Heard stories in Wild Space about a Togruta Force user. Supposedly she'd turned her back on both the Sith and Jedi.
Hard to say which ones are true, though. Details were always sketchy. Sorry I can't be more help.
I actually met her a few years ago. She'd joined some rebels launching guerilla attacks on remote Zakuulan outposts. Arcann tracked them down, eventually.
Kira thought you were dead. Everyone did. But she spoke highly of you. That's partly the reason I'm here.
I know you two were close. Kira thought you were dead, but I could tell she still had feelings for you. Wish I could tell you more.
Only a handful of rebels escaped. Not sure if she was with them.
In some of stories she was a hero, taking out bad guys and helping people in need. In other stories she was the bad guy.
Always good to meet a fellow Jedi.
You don't have any problem swearing allegiance to a Sith?
Could be useful, having another Jedi on board.
All the stories about me are true... and then some.
Seems like a lot of people want to join the Alliance, now that I'm winning.
If you don't like what I'm doing, then why are you here?
I'm Sith. What did you expect?
Let me guess... You want to show me a better path.
I don't have time for some Jedi Master who wants to redeem me.
Appreciate the welcome, but you need to know what you're getting into with me. I'm not the easiest person to get along with.
You're not like most Sith. And I'm just here to help, not take an oath of undying loyalty.
Thanks, but I don't want us to start on the wrong foot. You should know I'm not like most other Jedi.
Uh... good to know, I guess. I'd say the same, but I doubt you've heard any of the stories about me.
I'm not that kind of Jedi. I don't want to change you. I want to join you.
I admit I'm late to the party, but if you knew where I came from, you'd understand why it took so long to get here.
It's how you do things that worries me, not what you do. But at least you get results. That counts for a lot.
Okay, I'll give you that one. And you get results. I'll give you that, too.
Hardly. You've made your choice. I doubt I could change it. And I can't argue with your results.
We crossed paths a few years ago in the Unknown Regions. Didn't realize she was your Padawan. Makes sense though. She was obsessed with finding you.
When you disappeared, most of the galaxy thought you were dead. But a few folks--like Nadia--figured you'd gone into hiding. She refused to give up on you.
She kept going deeper into Wild Space, hoping to find you. Eventually, she didn't come back. Sorry I don't know more.
Jedi Master Dazh Ranos. Heard good things about you, Commander. Savior of the galaxy. Champion of the light side. Hope you live up to the hype.
Have you heard of a Sith called Lord Scourge?
The Emperor's Wrath? Never met him, but I've heard stories. Legends say the emperor made him immortal, but at a terrible cost.
He lives in constant pain, wandering the dark corners of the galaxy, searching for ancient Sith rituals to end his suffering.
Or so the story goes. Makes for a good morality tale, but it's a little far-fetched if you ask me.
I'm looking for an old friend. Jaesa Willsaam.
I know the name. They say she's insane. Obsessed with seeking out dark side artifacts on long forgotten worlds.
Everywhere she goes, she leaves a trail of bodies and broken lives, crushing anyone and anything that gets in her way.
Whatever your relationship with her, it's probably over. Jaesa only cares about one thing now: power.
I know the name. Reminded me of myself. Young Jedi turns her back on the Council and seeks her own path.
Always wanted to meet her. Even tried to track her down. Never found her. Maybe she doesn't want to be found.
Stories about her popped up from time to time during my journeys. She was out there on the frontier, standing up for people. Fighting the good fight.
